data_maturity_score.evidence: Focus on traditional BI/DW with Cognos and ETL tools (DataStage, Informatica), no mention of modern data stack (dbt, Airflow, Snowflake), limited cloud exposure as nice-to-have, no data quality testing or governance mentioned

data_maturity_level.evidence: Matches score of 2 - basic pipelines with ETL tools, some cloud exposure but not core, no advanced practices mentioned

maturity_signals.evidence: Heavy emphasis on Cognos, DataStage, Informatica - legacy BI/ETL tools; focus on batch ETL and reporting

scope_creep_score.evidence: Well-defined BI/Data Engineer role focused on reporting, ETL, and Cognos development without conflating with ML, DevOps, or backend responsibilities

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Onsite work model in Pune, India with 'relentless focus on quality' and 'evolutionary maintenance' suggesting potential for extended hours, but no explicit overtime or on-call mentions

role_clarity.evidence: Specific responsibilities around Cognos development, ETL, reporting, and UNIX with clear must-have skills

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low risk - well-defined role with reasonable experience requirements, but moderate overtime risk and legacy tech stack

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No mention of reporting manager or team structure in job posting

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No managerial titles or reporting structure mentioned

team_growth_velocity.evidence: Mentions working in IBM Consulting Client Innovation Centers but no specific team growth metrics

team_composition.evidence: No specific team size or composition details provided

reporting_structure.evidence: No information about reporting lines in the job posting

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Mentions working with business and technical team members but no indication of embedded cross-functional product teams

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Onsite work model in Pune, India with no PTO or work-life balance mentions, suggesting moderate risk to work-life balance

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: No explicit learning budget, conference support, or career path mentioned, though IBM may offer internal opportunities

tech_culture_score.evidence: Legacy tech stack (Cognos, DataStage), no mention of modern engineering practices, CI/CD, or testing

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source, tech blogs, conference speaking, hackathons, or innovation time

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of code review, CI/CD, testing, monitoring, or other development practices

innovation_signals.evidence: Focus on maintaining and evolving existing BI/DW environments rather than innovation or new technology adoption

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of tech debt management, refactoring, or modernization efforts

ai_integration_level.evidence: No mention of ML, AI, or GenAI in job description or requirements

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML tools mentioned in job posting

hiring_urgency.evidence: No urgency indicators like 'ASAP' or 'immediate start' mentioned

competition_level.evidence: IBM brand attracts candidates, Pune location has moderate competition, no salary disclosed which may reduce applications

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is a well-established technology company with global presence and delivery centers

hiring_velocity.evidence: IBM Consulting has ongoing hiring needs in delivery centers, suggesting steady rather than aggressive hiring

team_size_signals.evidence: No specific team size mentioned in job posting

funding_stage_signals.evidence: IBM is a publicly traded company with stable funding

role_creation_type.evidence: No indication whether this is a new headcount, backfill, or team expansion

strength_details: Clear BI/Data Engineer role with specific Cognos and ETL requirements
Established company (IBM) with global delivery center presence
Focused on core data engineering responsibilities without scope creep
concern_details: Heavy reliance on legacy tools (Cognos, DataStage) with limited modern stack exposure
No career growth path, learning opportunities, or tech culture details mentioned
Onsite work model in Pune may limit flexibility and work-life balance
best_fit_details: Mid-level engineers with 3+ years in BI/DW projects using Cognos and ETL tools
Candidates experienced in enterprise environments with legacy systems
Those seeking stable roles in established tech companies rather than startups
probe_details: Ask about the actual tech stack beyond Cognos and whether modern tools are being adopted
Inquire about typical work hours and any on-call or weekend work expectations
Understand potential career progression paths within IBM Consulting
leverage_details: Strong Cognos development and administration experience is a key differentiator
Experience with specific ETL tools (DataStage, Informatica) matches must-have requirements
summary.overall_assessment: Stable opportunity for mid-level data engineers with BI/DW experience seeking roles in established enterprises. Clear responsibilities focused on Cognos and ETL, but limited modern tech stack exposure and growth opportunities. Best suited for candidates prioritizing stability over innovation.
